subHeading.en-US: Get started with a Next.js and Contentful blog by using the starter repository that powers this site

description.en-US: Welcome to the Next.js and Contentful blog starter
Importing starter content model: brew install contentful-cli
Importing starter content model: yarn global add contentful-cli
Importing starter content model: install deps
Importing starter content model: npm install -g contentful-cli
Importing starter content model: run import

code.en-US:
cd nextjs-contentful-blog-starter/setup

contentful space import --space-id SPACE_ID --content-file content-model.json

description.en-US: ✨⚡️ I help developers build stuff, learn things, and love what they do • I code live on Twitch • DevRel • She/Her ⚡️✨

code.en-US:
cd nextjs-contentful-blog-starter/setup

contentful space import --space-id SPACE_ID --content-file content-export.json

excerpt.en-US: ATOL leisure travel merchant account and payment gateway.

content.value: ATOL leisure travel merchant account and payment gateway

ATOL is a licence required for businesses who want to sell flights. Often these businesses will offer flights in family packages, that also include hotels and food expenses covered. Payment processors do not offer their services to travel companies often leaving them stranded, because of their high risk nature.

However at Paytriot we specialise in high risk businesses and can offer travel companies our services. We will provide you with a merchant account and this will enable you to take payments on our gateway. Your high transaction values will mean fraudulent payments need to be covered with our 3d secure system, thus protecting your customers.
If you are interested in our services please contact our account managers. They will guide you through the set up process and beyond.
Who are Paytriot Payments?

Paytriot Payments is a UK based payment provider that provides merchant services to businesses looking to accept payments online or over the phone based in the UK and Europe. Paytriot is regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) in the United Kingdom and is listed with Visa and MasterCard to process card payments directly.

Our team have gained years of experience in multiple sectors in the industry and would be able to fully understand your business model whether your business sector is in a complex low risk or high-risk industry.

excerpt.en-US: What is considered as a High risk merchant account uk.

content.value: There are a number of factors that can consider a business as being a ‘high risk business’, however there are two main factors depending on whether the business is operating within a high fraud sector and the risk of financial failure within the business. What is taken into consideration are businesses with higher levels of charge backs which classes businesses within the ‘high risk’ sector, industries that have a bad reputation and long lead times.

There are a number of businesses that may fall under the ‘high risk’ industry that lead businesses looking for high risk merchant services in UK and Europe such as: gambling/casinos, e-cigarette and tobacco shops, call centres, high-volume eCommerce businesses, dating services, subscription payments, lotteries, CBD businesses, financial services, insurance companies, loans etc. This is just some of the many businesses that we provide merchant services to.

Being in a high risk industry can make it difficult to acquire high risk card processing in UK and Europe for taking both credit and debit card payments online. We at Paytriot Payments offer bespoke services to individual businesses. What makes Paytriot different from other high risk merchant services providers in UK and Europe are generally our high risk merchant accounts in the UK and Europe receive:
Low monthly fees
Low rolling reserves
Short settlement periods
Increased account security

You will gain access to our merchant management dashboard which provides you with the ability to run reports, graphs and analytics so that you have full clarity on all credit card processing and payment processing at anytime. The dashboard can be accessed globally with a secure internet connection and can be used via smartphone, tablet, laptop, pc etc.

Banks are usually very aware of who they set up accounts for when the businesses are within the high risk industry. However, Paytriot is listed directly with Visa and MasterCard allowing us to process payments on behalf of merchants and underwrite a merchant application in house. Our payment gateway offers access to security and control over each account allowing merchants to restrict accepting payments from certain countries and giving merchants access to card verification options and increased security when taking payments.
The difference?

With other high risk merchant services providers in UK and Europe you may be paying higher transaction fees as to them this would be a higher risk than a standard merchant account. With Paytriot we look at each individual application when we provide merchant accounts for businesses and less likely to consider it a high risk merchant account or a high risk card processing.
Transaction fees
We tailor bespoke package transaction value depending on the nature of the business sector, business model and the products/services sold.

excerpt.en-US: CBD products merchant account and payment acquiring.

content.value: CBD products merchant account and payment acquiring

CBD, short for cannabidiol, is a non-intoxicating compound found in cannabis plants that has gained popularity for its potential health benefits. However, due to its association with marijuana and the legal grey area surrounding CBD, businesses that sell CBD products face unique challenges when it comes to payment processing. That's where merchant accounts and payment gateways come into play.

Merchant accounts are accounts that allow businesses to accept credit and debit card payments. These accounts are set up with acquiring banks, which act as intermediaries between the business and the card networks such as Visa and Mastercard. The acquiring bank ensures that the transactions are valid and that the funds are transferred to the merchant's account.

Payment gateways are the technology that connects the merchant account to the card networks. They process the payment transactions and encrypt the sensitive information to ensure secure transmission of data.

However, not all merchant account providers and payment gateways are willing to work with businesses that sell CBD products. This is where Paytriot Payments comes in. Paytriot Payments is a UK-based payment processing company that specializes in high-risk industries, including CBD businesses.

Paytriot Payments offers merchant accounts specifically for CBD businesses, which allows them to accept credit and debit card payments from their customers. They also provide payment gateway services that integrate with popular e-commerce platforms like WooCommerce, Shopify, and Magento.

In addition to their merchant account and payment gateway services, Paytriot Payments also provides compliance and regulatory support to ensure that CBD businesses are operating within the legal boundaries. This includes assistance with age verification and anti-money laundering procedures.

Another benefit of using Paytriot Payments for CBD payment processing is their competitive pricing. They offer transparent pricing with no hidden fees, which can be a relief for business owners who have experienced unexpected charges and fees with other payment processors.

In summary, for businesses that sell CBD products, having a reliable and secure payment processing solution is essential. Paytriot Payments offers merchant accounts and payment gateways specifically designed for CBD businesses, along with compliance and regulatory support and competitive pricing. With their expertise in high-risk industries, they are a valuable partner for CBD businesses looking to accept credit and debit card payments.

excerpt.en-US: PAYTRIOT PAYMENTS HELP HIGH RISK BUSINESSES RECEIVE MERCHANT ACCOUNTS IN HOURS INSTEAD

content.value: Paytriot Payments help high risk businesses receive merchant accounts in hours instead of weeks!

Acquiring banks only offer certain business sector’s merchant services and card payment services. This makes it difficult to find an account solution for your online payments if you are a high risk business sector trying to accept credit and debit cards. Third party providers that have services offered such as payment processing tend to use offshore merchant accounts which leads to high rolling reserves, longer settlement periods, higher transaction fees along with high termination fees.

If you are a business accepting credit and debit card and are looking for a high risk merchant account and business bank account then Paytriot Payments can help you achieve this with minimal time and effort needed. Our settlement period starts from 3 days for high risk sectors and if you need a regular merchant account for card payments we can provide next day settlement.

Our Level 1 PCI DSS compliant payment gateway and card terminals has built-in fraud tools to help reduce chargebacks and tackle fraudulent transactions at the forefront reducing the need for PCI compliance on your website. Tokenisation of transactions can help you store card details to use for card payments for your customers on a subscription. We can help you import tokens from other providers you are currently with such as Stripe and Paypal if you were looking to save on card transaction fees. Online merchant account start at a rolling 30 day contract allowing you not to have early termination fees as you may receive from another acquiring bank.

Credit card processing on your site could never be more simpler to set up. We process for UK merchants and European Merchants. Paytriot is an FCA regulated firm, customer service, customer support all based in the UK and has a direct relationship with Visa and MasterCard. One simple application form will allow you to set up your gateway, merchant account and accepting card payments in hours with very competitive merchant account fees.

Websites such as eBay and Gumtree have become extremely popular because they allow people to sell their unwanted second-hand goods. Both eBay and Gumtree have had success for many years and will continue to do so for years to come. The following article covers how Paytriot Payments can support your business when taking online payments for second-hand products.

Electronics such as game consoles and mobile phones are the most popular second-hand products available because they have the resale value and are always in demand. People are likely to buy these products second hand as they are cheaper than the market value for the new versions of products, thus making them more affordable to customers. Additionally, some electronics may not be available to purchase as a new product after some time, making second-hand products their only option.

Second-hand products can also be luxury watches or jewellery that is being resold due its high value or rarity. Collectors are likely to invest in these products so that they can add to their collections. Antique products are also sold on second-hand sites, and they are in high demand to the older population.

Furniture is often sold on second-hand sites and those on a budget such as students will purchase this so that they can save money. The quality is often very similar to that of new furniture therefore making them a viable alternative.

Trainers have become a very popular item when looking at second-hand products and can be found on them easily. Trainers tend to sell out quickly which means second-hand products are the best option for those who want to purchase specific trainers, however they must pay a premium to get this.

excerpt.en-US: Partners

content.value: The financial industry is one of the most complex and dynamic industries in the world. It is characterized by a wide range of services and products that are designed to help individuals and businesses manage their finances, investments, and other related activities. In such a complex ecosystem, having reliable partners can be a key to success for any financial company. In this blog, we'll explore the importance of partners in the financial industry and some of the partners that are vital to the success of paytriot.co.uk.
Why Partners are Important in the Financial Industry

Partnerships are critical in the financial industry because they enable businesses to access expertise and resources that they may not possess. With the ever-changing regulatory environment, technological advancements, and competitive landscape, it can be challenging for businesses to keep up with the latest trends and developments. Partnerships allow financial companies to expand their capabilities and offerings, enter new markets, and better serve their clients.

Additionally, partnerships in the financial industry can help reduce costs, increase efficiencies, and improve the overall customer experience. For example, partnering with a payment gateway provider can help a financial company streamline its payment processes, reduce transaction fees, and offer more payment options to its clients.
Key Partners for paytriot.co.uk
As a payment service provider, paytriot.co.uk relies on several key partners to provide its clients with a range of payment solutions. Some of the critical partners include:

Acquiring Banks: Acquiring banks are responsible for processing credit and debit card payments on behalf of paytriot.co.uk's clients. These banks are essential partners because they provide the necessary infrastructure, security, and expertise to process payments securely and efficiently.

Payment Gateways: Payment gateways act as intermediaries between paytriot.co.uk's clients and acquiring banks. They help manage payment transactions, reduce the risk of fraud, and ensure that payments are processed securely and quickly. Paytriot.co.uk partners with several payment gateway providers to offer its clients a range of payment options and features.

Fraud Prevention Providers: Fraud prevention providers help paytriot.co.uk's clients mitigate the risk of fraudulent transactions. These partners offer advanced fraud detection and prevention tools that help identify and prevent fraudulent activities, ensuring that paytriot.co.uk's clients can transact safely and securely.

Card Schemes: Card schemes such as Visa, Mastercard, and American Express are critical partners for paytriot.co.uk. These schemes provide the necessary infrastructure and rules for processing card payments, ensuring that paytriot.co.uk's clients can accept payments from customers who use these cards.

excerpt.en-US: Privacy Policy

content.value: As a payment service provider, Paytriot Payments understands the importance of privacy and takes the privacy of its customers very seriously. In this blog, we'll take a closer look at Paytriot's privacy policy and the measures it takes to protect the privacy of its customers.
What Information Does Paytriot Collect?

Paytriot collects various types of information from its customers, including personal information such as name, address, email address, and phone number. Paytriot also collects financial information such as bank account numbers, credit card numbers, and transaction details. This information is necessary for Paytriot to process payments and provide its services to customers.
How Does Paytriot Use Customer Information?
Paytriot uses customer information for a variety of purposes, including:
Processing payments: Paytriot uses customer information to process payments and ensure that transactions are completed securely and efficiently.
Fraud prevention: Paytriot uses customer information to identify and prevent fraudulent transactions and to protect the security of customer accounts.

Customer service: Paytriot may use customer information to provide customer service and support, including responding to inquiries, resolving issues, and providing information about Paytriot's services.
Marketing: Paytriot may use customer information to promote its services and to communicate with customers about offers, promotions, and other marketing materials.
How Does Paytriot Protect Customer Information?
Paytriot takes numerous measures to protect the privacy and security of customer information. These measures include:
Secure data storage: Paytriot stores customer information on secure servers that are protected by firewalls and other security measures.
Encryption: Paytriot uses industry-standard encryption technologies to protect customer information during transmission and storage.
Access controls: Paytriot limits access to customer information to authorized personnel who need the information to perform their job duties.
Monitoring and testing: Paytriot regularly monitors its systems and performs security testing to identify and address any vulnerabilities.
Does Paytriot Share Customer Information with Third Parties?

Paytriot may share customer information with third-party service providers who perform services on behalf of Paytriot, such as payment processors, fraud prevention providers, and marketing agencies. Paytriot may also share customer information with law enforcement agencies or other third parties if required by law or if necessary to protect the safety or security of Paytriot's customers or employees.
